mdRecord.dcterms:title: Mount Vernon Estate, Tomb
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Glass plate negative of the new tomb. The view is taken from the west side of the structure and shows the clearing of overgrowth. Also visible are the two marble obelisks and the wooden planked pathway. Two individuals are present, a white male and a young African American boy. The man seems to have accompanied the photographer as a model as he appears in a companion photograph of the Mansion [R-221 ; EV-1007c]. Inscribed into the emulsion at the bottom left of the negative is, “Washington's Tomb - Mt. Vernon, Va. 1858 K38”. The remainder of the caption, including copyright information, has been scratch from the surface making it illegible.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: p Washington, George, 1732-1799--Tomb
